ai.summary: A short and easy coastal walk of 1.6 km from Leebitton to Cunningsburgh. Suitable for beginners and families, this route offers gentle terrain, sea views, and a relaxed pace along a quiet UK coastline.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat coastal path with compacted gravel and grassy sections. Some damp or muddy patches after rain and a few exposed, windy stretches along the shore. Ground may be uneven near the foreshore.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and sea conditions before setting out; coastal winds can be strong and temperatures may be cool. Stay on marked paths, beware of soft ground near the shoreline, and be mindful of changing tides. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear, dress in layers, and carry a lightweight rain jacket. Bring water and a small snack, a map or GPS, and a charged phone; let someone know your plan if walking alone.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
Lightweight waterproof jacket and layered clothing
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with emergency contacts and a charged battery
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn (roughly April to October) typically offer the nicest conditions and daylight for this easy coastal walk. Winter can be windy, wet, and less comfortable.
